description: Construction of a two storey dwelling with parking, formation of a vehicular crossover and associated landscaping and amenity space.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title numbers PL01B, PL06B, PL08F received 19/09/2012 unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local Planning Authority. REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, a noise survey and details for mitigation works to protect habitable rooms from external noise shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The mitigation shall also take into account the ventilation strategy for the building approved in accordance with Condition 4 of this permission.  The approved details shall be fully implemented prior to the first occupation of the building and retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the residential units  from external traffic noise, in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan 2011 and policies  4.1, 5.5 and  4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (j) and 3.8 of the Ealing's Development Strategy and Supplementary Planning Guidance SPG 10: 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding any information submitted with the application and prior to the commencement of the development hereby approved, details of the installation of the AAC Eurovent Nitrogen Dioxide Filtration System in the building hereby approved and how it will be maintained shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.  The approved measures shall be fully installed prior to first occupation of the development and shall be retained thereafter.  REASON:  To protect occupiers of the residential units  from the air poluted by vehicles using the A40, in accordance with policy 7.14 of the London Plan 2011 and policies  2.6,  4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004), policies 1.1 (j) and 3.8 of the Ealing's Development Strategy | No occupation of the residential units hereby approved shall take place until full details of boundary treatments and hard/soft landscape works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be completed as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season. REASON:  To ensure that the development is satisfactorily landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area and setting of the building, and in accordance with policies 3.5 and 7.4 of the London Plan 2011 and policies 4.1, 4.5 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3.8 of the Ealing's Development Strategy. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Class F of Part 1 of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995 (amended 2008),  no provision of hard surface to the dwellinghouses hereby approved shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application. REASON: To prevent an increased risk of flooding and to improve and protect water quality in accordance with section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 2.5 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of surfacing of the rear driveway hereby approved shall be submitted to and approved by the local planning authority. The surface materials shall be porous. Such provision as approved shall be completed and brought into use prior to the construction of the dwelling hereby approved and retained for the life of the development  REASON:	To ensure that there is adequate provision for car parking within the site, in accordance with policy 6.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 9.1 of the Adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of a drainage/soakaway scheme for the site (including surface water drainage), based on sustainable drainage principles shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the development. The development shall be implemented only as approved and retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  REASON: To ensure the drainage measures comply with sustainability requirements, to prevent the increased risk of flooding and to improve and protect water quality in accordance with section 10 of the National Planning Policy Framework, policies 5.12 and 5.13 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 2.5 of the Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards. REASON: To ensure access for all for future occupiers in accordance with policy 7.2 of the London Plan 2011 and policy 5.3 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
